title: How to Make an Anime Kitty Hat

steps.headline: Buy the fabric.
Fleece and furry fabrics are best for this.
steps.description: They can be anywhere from $1-$12 a yard, it depends where you get it and how nice it is. You will need about 1 or 1 ⁄2 yards (0.9 or 1.4 m).

steps.headline: Measure your head.
Measure the length around your head (see A)
Measure the length from the middle of your forehead to the middle of the top of your head (see B).
steps.description: Write it down so you don't forget.

steps.headline: Make yourself a pattern.
Make 4 "pattern 1"s using your measurements.
Pick your ears, use pattern 2, 3, or 4 for kitty ears or 5 for floppy bunny ears.
steps.description: Make 2 patterns for each ear. (you should have four ear patterns)

steps.headline: Cut out your patterns
Pin the patterns to your fabric and cut the fabric out.
Take 2 "pattern 1"s and place them together bad side out and sew up one of the edges.
Repeat number 6 with the other "pattern 1"s
Sew your ear patterns together so that you are left with 2 ears.
Take your two sewn together "pattern 1"s and place them together with the kitty ears on the edge facing inward (see picture) It is kind of like a kitty ear sandwich.
Sew up the sides.
steps.description: don't sew up the bottom and make a ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) seam at the bottom. Next, flip right side out.

steps.headline: Enjoy your hat!
steps.description: It's sure to be wonderful! (It's very cute)

steps.headline: While buying fabric, pick up a cheap fleece hat pattern or find one online.
Follow the directions to sew the hat but leave the top side seams open.
Cut out four identical triangles of fabric for the ears and sew them together so that you have two triangles.
steps.description: (Make sure you have the 'right' side of the fabric facing in, then turn inside-out so the seams don't show!)

steps.headline: Sew the triangles into the seams on top of the head, adjusting as necessary until you're pleased with the outcome.

text: Steps Buy the fabric.  Fleece and furry fabrics are best for this. They can be anywhere from $1-$12 a yard, it depends where you get it and how nice it is. You will need about 1 or 1 ⁄2 yards (0.9 or 1.4 m). Measure your head.  Measure the length around your head (see A)  Measure the length from the middle of your forehead to the middle of the top of your head (see B). Write it down so you don't forget. Make yourself a pattern.  Make 4 "pattern 1"s using your measurements.  Pick your ears, use pattern 2, 3, or 4 for kitty ears or 5 for floppy bunny ears. Make 2 patterns for each ear. (you should have four ear patterns) Cut out your patterns  Pin the patterns to your fabric and cut the fabric out.  Take 2 "pattern 1"s and place them together bad side out and sew up one of the edges.  Repeat number 6 with the other "pattern 1"s  Sew your ear patterns together so that you are left with 2 ears.  Take your two sewn together "pattern 1"s and place them together with the kitty ears on the edge facing inward (see picture) It is kind of like a kitty ear sandwich.  Sew up the sides. don't sew up the bottom and make a ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) seam at the bottom. Next, flip right side out. Enjoy your hat! It's sure to be wonderful! (It's very cute) Alternate Method While buying fabric, pick up a cheap fleece hat pattern or find one online.  Follow the directions to sew the hat but leave the top side seams open.  Cut out four identical triangles of fabric for the ears and sew them together so that you have two triangles. (Make sure you have the 'right' side of the fabric facing in, then turn inside-out so the seams don't show!) Sew the triangles into the seams on top of the head, adjusting as necessary until you're pleased with the outcome.
